title: SB 1.19.13 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 19-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chaksharan Melitam Jena Dasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Niti Namine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Ganadhara Shri Vasani Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 13th verse of the
The meaning of this verse is
Indeed we are the most great
Who are trained to get favours
And left in a distant place
So these are the first words
And standing up with folded hands
And telling them of his decision
That the appearance of all those great saintly persons
Pariksit Maharaj is the greatest saintly person
Who has ever been worshipped as a saintly person
He is the greatest saintly person who has ever been worshipped as a saintly person
To be able to get such wonderful association
At the last stage of his
In the association of great saintly persons
And left in a distant place
So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport
Must be left at a long distance
Far away from where we live
is cited herein in relation to the kingly order for those who are progressively marching
back to Godhead. So, if you are serious about going back to Godhead, you should not associate
too much with worldly-minded people. And Lord Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu said that to be in
intimate touch with dollars and cents men or the kingly order is worse than suicide
for one who desires to go back to Godhead. What does Chaitanya Mahaprabhu say? Nishkinchanasyabhagavadbhajanonmukhasyaparamparamjigamishorbhavasagarasya
If one is a saintly person, nishkinchana means he is a renunciant, he has given up all material
possessions and he is engaged in bhagavadbhajana, in devotional service to Krishna.
If only he is an artist, he will do all these acts of flattery, będzie Reid revere.
But if he doesn't do any of this, he will fundamentally say, that this is what
Anathapusriyuma spirituality ricord-shri ở 37aji põ . Course 14th March, 2017.
one shore of the ocean to the other shore. Ocean means a huge body of water. You cannot
expect that you will cross over the ocean by swimming, by your own endeavour, independent
endeavour. No. So material existence is not easy to cross over. It is compared to an ocean.
So many obstacles and difficulties are there in crossing over this material existence.
So such a person, a serious person, a serious transcendentalist, for him, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu
says, sandarshanam vishainam atha yoshitam ca, merely glancing, sandarshanam vishainam
sense enjoyers, or objects of sense gratification, vishainam atha yoshitam ca, ha hantahant vishabhakshanato
pya sadhu, is worse than willingly drinking poison.
So it is very, very important.
So, it is very, very important.
So, it is very, very important.
So, it is very, very important.
So, it is very, very important.
So, it is very, very dangerous for a saintly person, who has renounced all material facilities
and comforts, to even look at sense gratifiers or objects of sense enjoyment.
So, this is Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's instruction.

not generally associate with men who are too enamored by the external beauty of God's creation.
Whatever material beauty that is actually the creation of the illusory energy meant
for those who want to enjoy materially and thereby become entangled in material existence
and continue the repetition of birth and death, whereas transcendentalists give up
all illusory sense objects, objects of sense gratification and also don't associate with
By advanced knowledge in spiritual realization, the transcendentalist knows that there is
nothing but a shadowy reflection of the reality, the kingdom of God.
This is very clearly explained in the 15th chapter, .
This material world is a perverted reflection of the spiritual world.
Reflection means the object which is reflected and seen as a reflection.
That object is the real reality.
Reflection is not the reality, it is a shadow of the reality.
So, if you are interested in reality.
If you have a material world, which is the kingdom of God, then this material world,
however nice it may appear or however nice it may be promising, it actually is nothing
other than a reflection or a shadow.
It means there is no substance in trying to enjoy materially.
So, a transcendentalist who has got advanced knowledge in spiritual realization knows this
fact, has realized this fact and therefore such transcendentalists are not very much
captivated by royal opulence or anything like that.
They are not attracted by the palace in which a king may stay, the comfortable facilities
a very rich man may have for his bodily comforts, for his enjoyment, for his happiness, material
A transcendentalist is never attracted by any of those things.
This is not possible, only if there is realization of the knowledge.
First of all one has to hear from the proper authority, spiritual authority.
And then one has to internalize that, what has been heard and digest that information,
realized knowledge, jnana has to become vijnana, then vijnana means one is able to practice,
one is able to follow, one is able to act on the platform of that knowledge.
Now here Srila Prabhupada says about Pariksit Maharaj, but in the case of Pariksit Maharaj
Apparently the king was condemned to death by an inexperienced brahmana boy.
So it appears like when the king was cursed, oh he had insulted the sage, therefore the
sage Shamika Rishi, his Shamika Rishi's son Sringi, a powerful brahmana boy condemned
King Pariksit to die within seven days by snake bite, so somebody may think that the
king is a very ordinary person in spiritual terms, he is very ordinary person, he is foolishly
acted by insulting a great saintly person, a great sage, but no.
Prabhupada clarifies, don't mistake Pariksit to be an ordinary worldly person.
But factually Pariksit was called by the Lord to return to him, to return to God.
So it is Krishna's arrangement for Pariksit to return back to godhead immediately.

So, Prabhupada says further, other transcendentalists, the great sages and mystics who assembled together because of Maharaj Parikshit's fasting unto death, were quite anxious to see him for he was going back to Godhead.
Why did these great sages come there? They knew that Parikshit is not an ordinary king, he is a pure devotee and he is ready to go back to Godhead. Let us associate with him.
Maharaj Parikshit could also understand that the great sages who assembled there were all kind to his forefathers, the Pandavas, because of their devotional service to the Lord.
See, devotional service is the topmost spiritual practice and great devotees are recognized by advanced transcendentalists as the topmost transcendentalists in the material world.

So, Pandavas were respected like that and Parikshit Maharaj was a descendant of the Pandavas. Therefore, he was very happy to actually receive the great sages and have their association at the last moment of his life.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
